title: CMPD: 5 people shot in west Charlotte bar
content:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Police are still searching for the gunman who shot five people at a west Charlotte bar early Sunday morning.
All five shooting victims are in stable condition, according to the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department.
Sylvia Tate witnessed everything unfold. She came face to face with the gunman just before shots rang out.
"He just look at me and I saw the gun and he just started shooting," said Tate.
Sylvia said she wanted to stop him, but she couldn't move. Her body froze.
"I could've helped them if I would've tackled him, but I was scared of the gun," said Tate.
Five people were hit. Sylvia watched as they were dragged from the building.
The owner of Reba Bar and Grill called Sunday mornings shooting, "Unspeakable and totally unacceptable."
For hours CMPD canvassed the area searching for clues to find the man that pulled the trigger. At the scene, shattered glass and bullet holes which both served as reminders for Sylvia on how lucky she is to be alive.
"He could have turned the gun on me," said Tate.
Woman came face to face w/ gunman who shot 5 ppl at #CLT club @CMPD still searching for shooter @wcnc pic.twitter.com/3eukSWX9r2
— Xavier Walton (@xmanwalton) June 26, 2016
